channel.title: List on It's Pronounced Metrosexual
channel.description: Recent content in List on It's Pronounced Metrosexual

item.title: Your Ally is Someone Who‚Ä¶ (A Few Ways to Be #BetterAllies)
item.description: To celebrate GLSEN‚Äòs Ally Week, It Gets Better and I put our heads¬†together¬†to create a series of images. These comics exemplify what¬†_they¬†_described as the top traits of better allies, and in my best ally fashion I used my doodling powers to elevate that¬†message.

item.title: 15+ Fantastic Resources for Talking about ‚ÄúHomosexuality‚Äù (i.e., LGBTQ people) and The Bible
item.description: Only a tiny, tiny part of the bible can even be argued to reference ‚Äúhomosexuality‚Äù (and that argument, in a few of the verses in particular, is worth looking into), yet it seems like whenever we hear about the Bible in the news it‚Äôs being slammed against LGBTQ equality.

item.title: 30+ Examples of Masculine Dude (‚ÄúBro‚Äù) Privileges
item.description: I‚Äôve written a few privilege lists, several of which are about privileged identities I possess. They are serious articles that provide a couple hundred examples of systemic oppression (in the US and elsewhere). This article is not that. I ask that you please humor me as I take a moment to address the many privileges I¬†_don‚Äôt¬†_have access to, due to my gender expression/ metrosexuality.

item.title: Comprehensive* List of LGBTQ+ Vocabulary Definitions
item.description: Hi! This post is now available as part of an E-Book called “Defining LGBTQ+”. It includes the most recently updated definitions for all the terms below, the rules, and a bunch of other stuff. You can download it as a .

item.title: 5 Reasons Why So Many People Believe Feminism Hates Men and Why They‚Äôre Not True
item.description:
‚ÄúThe feminist agenda is not about equal rights for women. It is about a socialist, anti-family political movement that encourages women to leave their husbands, kill their children, practice witchcraft, destroy capitalism, and become lesbians.‚Äù

Pat Robertson famously said this in the 90s, and the sentiment still rings as true in the ears of many today. ¬†It‚Äôs an understatement to say that¬†feminism has a bad rap.

Feminism doesn‚Äôt hate men.

So why do so many people think feminism = man-hating? Let‚Äôs look at a few explanations for this fallacy.

item.title: 30+ Examples of Male Privileges
item.description: Following is a list of male privileges. If you are male (and a man), listed below are benefits that result from being born with that gender and sex. If you identify as a man, there‚Äôs a good chance you‚Äôve never thought about these things.

item.title: 50+ concrete things you can do today to make for a more socially just tomorrow
item.description:
Social justice ‚Äî the idea that everyone in a society, regardless of the identities they embody, can have an equitable shot at success and happiness ‚Äî is a goal that seems unrealistic for many people. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a pipe dream, Sam,‚Äù they say, smugly. ‚ÄúLife isn‚Äôt rainbows and butterflies,‚Äù they say, adorably.

üíåMost Wednesdays

I publish new Social Justice, Gender, & Sexuality Resources.

Get the Email.

To achieve social justice we will have to break down a lot of huge barriers that exist on a scale far above the individual, but even the biggest scale change is nothing more than the sum of a whole lot of individual efforts. ¬†My goal with this site is to support you in doing just that: making big change on an individual level.

Following are a whole¬†lot of individual efforts you can make today that will be significant steps toward that biggest scale change we need for a socially just tomorrow.

item.title: 30+ Examples of Middle-to-Upper Class Privileges
item.description: Following is a list of middle-to-upper class privileges. If you are a member of the middle class or upper class economic groups (or, in some cases, perceived to be) listed below are benefits that may be granted to you based on your group membership ‚Äî benefits not granted to folks in the lower classes.

item.title: 4 Reasons You Should Stop Saying ‚ÄúNon-Straight‚Äù
item.description: With all the talk of marriage equality, gay comic book weddings, and even gayer flowcharts flowing around the web, people are getting ever more sensitive about using inclusive language when they can. That‚Äôs great!¬†But more often than ever I am hearing folks use the term ‚Äúnon-straight‚Äù to refer to people who are lesbian, gay, bi-, pan- or even trans*.

item.title: 30+ Examples of Christian Privileges
item.description: Following is a list of privileges granted to people in the U.S. (and many western nations) for being Christian. üíåMost Wednesdays I publish new Social Justice, Gender, & Sexuality Resources. Get the Email. Please comment below if you have any additions or revisions to make!

item.title: 5 Reasons My Approach to Social Justice Work is Better than Yours
item.description:
The way I approach social justice and ally work on this site and¬†in my show has a distinct flavor. ¬†Some would call it sweet, but I think ginger is a bit spicy.

I don‚Äôt often do things by accident, and in this case it is very _on purpose. ¬†_My flavor is even so noticeable that if you‚Äôve seen a lot of what I‚Äôve created here, you‚Äôre likely taken aback by the headline of this article. ¬†Well, that actually leads me into my first point.

item.title: My Reasons for being an Ally (AKA Social Justice Advocate)
item.description:
Hey, folks. ¬†First of all, thanks for continuing to read what I write here, and thanks even more for sharing. ¬†I don't say that enough. ¬†I've been thinking a lot about why I do what I do lately, and I want to once-and-for-all answer a question I get asked an average of 1.6 times per day.

“Sam, why do you do what you do?” people say, but they are only saying half of what they're thinking.

Depending on the context, they might be thinking, “Sam, if you're¬†straight, why do you work so much for gay equality?” ¬†Or “Sam, you're a man, why do you work so much for women's or trans people's equality” ¬†Or “Sam, you're White, why do you care about equality for people of color?” ¬†Or “Sam, you're a huge dork, why don't you do anything about that?” ¬†And on it goes.

My answer is different every time, because it's hard for me to get down to the absolute root of it all. ¬†But let me provide some of the front-runner explanations for why I do what I do.

item.title: 3 Reasons Positive Stereotypes aren‚Äôt that Positive
item.description:
In my show, I address the issue of positive stereotypes head-on, but I wanted to write an article about it as well. ¬†For those of you unaware, positive stereotypes are assumptions about an entire group or identity (e.g., gay men) that are considered to be “good.”

Some examples of positive stereotypes of gay men: they are artsy, friendly, fun, social, well-spoken, well-dressed, well-groomed, fit, and sassy (I think sassy is positive). ¬†The list goes on. ¬†Those are all good things, yeah? ¬†There can‚Äôt be any harm in perpetuating those stereotypes, right?

Wrong.

Positive stereotypes exist for just about every identity and have the capacity to be just as damaging as the negative ones. ¬†Don‚Äôt believe me? ¬†Read this list of reasons why and get back to me afterward. ¬†Oh, and if you have any additional examples, as always, share them in the comments below.

item.title: 5+ Ways to Make Our World More Trans*-Friendly
item.description:
We live in a world that recognizes two options for gender. ¬†If you‚Äôre not exactly ‚Äúman‚Äù or ‚Äúwoman‚Äù you‚Äôre going to have a hard time finding your place, because right now there isn‚Äôt a place¬†for you. ¬†Let‚Äôs change that.

Following is a list of suggestions to make the world a bit less binary and a lot more transgender inclusive. ¬†Read ‚Äôem, live ‚Äôem, and add to ‚Äôem in the comments below.

item.title: 10 reasons LEGOs aren‚Äôt for girls
item.description: Update:¬†check out this video of a little girl explaining her frustration with gendered toys. It‚Äôs amazing how gendered toys are. If you see an action figure, you think boy. If you see a barbie, you think girl. If you see a boy with a barbie, you think gay.

item.title: 30+ Examples of Heterosexual (Straight) Privileges
item.description: Following is a list of¬†examples of heterosexual privilege. If you are straight,¬†these are unearned benefits you receive as a result of the sexuality you were born with. If you are straight (or in some cases, perceived to be), you can live without ever having to think twice, face, confront, engage, or cope with anything listed below.

item.title: 30+ Examples of Cisgender Privileges
item.description: Heads up! I wrote a book all about gender that provides tools for standing up against gender-based oppression (like the things below) and working toward a socially justice society. If you appreciate all that jazz, you‚Äôll love this book. Following is a list of cisgender identity privileges.
